title: How to Turn on the Apple Watch

steps.title: Make sure that the Apple Watch is off.
steps.content: Make sure that the Apple Watch is off. If the screen lights up with a watch dial when you raise the watch or press the Digital Crown dial on the side, the Apple Watch is on. [1] X Research source You can turn off an Apple Watch by pressing and holding the oval Power button below the Digital Crown and then swiping the "Power Off" switch to the right. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Find your Apple Watch's Power button.
steps.content: Find your Apple Watch's Power button. It's an oval button on the right side of the Apple Watch's housing, just below the dial-shaped Digital Crown button. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Press the Power button.
steps.content: Press the Power button. You don't need to press and hold this buttonâ€”pressing and releasing it will be enough to turn on your Apple Watch. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Wait for the Apple logo to appear.
steps.content: Wait for the Apple logo to appear. If you see the white Apple logo appear on the Apple Watch's screen after a few seconds, your Apple Watch is powering on. [5] X Research source Your Apple Watch will usually take less than a minute to finish powering on. [6] X Research source If the Apple Watch won't power on, or if you see the outline of a battery appear instead of the Apple logo, you need to charge your Apple Watch for a few minutes before trying to turn it on. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Enter your passcode when prompted.
steps.content: Enter your passcode when prompted. If your Apple Watch uses a passcode, you'll be prompted to enter it as soon as the Apple Watch finishes powering on. This will unlock the Apple Watch, making it ready for use. The Apple Watch will stay unlocked as long as it is on your wrist. [8] X Research source
